title: Mathematics Pedagogy Workshop Utilizing Conversational Learning Models

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic mathematics education theory and lesson design
context.additional_context: Curriculum exploring the application of dialogic learning models in mathematics education for pre-service and in-service teachers. Learners enhance teaching competencies through group activities utilizing technological environments and formative assessments.

learning_goals: Structure mathematical problem-solving processes using a four-stage group dialogue protocol (questioning-explaining-connecting-reflecting)

Learners visualize at least three abstract mathematical concepts (e.g., function graphs, multidimensional spaces, set theory) using digital tools (ExplainBoard, Miro, etc.), submit two or more activity design plans shareable on collaborative platforms, and achieve an 80% or higher peer feedback incorporation rate.

Learners develop a formative assessment rubric with five or more criteria suitable for interactive math classes (functions, calculus, etc.) by reflecting on three or more peer feedbacks, apply it to two or more teaching practices, and achieve an 80% or higher peer evaluation satisfaction rate.

resources: Digital collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
